meta.title: An Overview of the Wambule/Umbule Region

nodes.body: The Wambule are a Rai ethnic group of eastern Nepal who speak a Tibeto-Burman language of the same name and which is a Kiranti language. According to the 2001 census of Nepal, 4,471 people speak Wambule as a mother tongue. (Mark Turin â€“ June 01, 2004)
nodes.title: An Overview of the Wambule/Umbule Region
